description:
Stereolab’s Tim Gane & Joe Dilworth, plus Holger Zapf, at their best supplying original sonic scenery and perfectly suggestive cues for ‘In Fabric’, the 2018 horror directed and written by Peter Strickland (Berberian Sound Studio)

Suzanne Ciani

              —
              Music For Denali
            
              (Finders Keepers Records)
label: Finders Keepers Records
description:
Finders Keepers prize a gorgeous 1973 soundtrack of keys and isolationist electronics from the Ciani archive showcasing a rarer minimalist side - revelatory stuff, think Harmonia and Eno meets Mika Vainio and Christina Kubisch

Created for a film about a skier making the first descent of Alaska’s highest mountain, ‘Music For Denali’ affords an ideal canvas for... more

artist: Rick Myers, Andy Votel, Sean Canty
title_full:
Rick Myers, Andy Votel, Sean Canty

              —
              Human Engineering
            
              (Pre-Cert Home Entertainment)
label: Pre-Cert Home Entertainment
description:
Sean Canty and Andy Votel explore new territory within the realms of broken music, mechanical composition, spoken-word and noise collage with the help of multi disciplinary artist and longtime cohort Rick Myers, feeding Pre-Cert's gothic ambience into more unnerving corridors. We’re very here for it.

Myers is Votel's longest running collaborator (and... more

Jon Brooks

              —
              How To Get To Spring
            
              (Clay Pipe Music)
label: Clay Pipe Music
description:
Jon Brook’s ‘How to Get to Spring’ is his fourth record on Clay Pipe. Stepping into new sonic territory with a gentle nod to his more recent Advisory Circle work, he has produced a beautiful new record that moves us gently from the winter into the spring.

“It’s when we realise that even the most seemingly inextricable connections are but, a flicker. Despite devices... more

title_full:
Alain Pierre

              —
              Ô Sidarta
            
              (Finders Keepers Records)
label: Finders Keepers Records
description:
Wow OK - this spooky soundtrack to recently-rediscovered 1974 short film "Ô Sidarta" is a doozy, all fuzzy analog synth drones, Popol Vuh/Klaus Schulze wobbles and choppy, dubbed-to-death Luc Ferrari vs. Radiophonic Workshop squeak. Gasping.

Just when you think that everything's been dug out of the cult electronic-music-meets-horror-sci-fi... more

label: Alga Marghen
description:
Fascinating and beautifully haunting, ‘Phonopoetics’ extends an unmissable introduction to the “verbophonic” orchestrations of Serbo-Hungarian vocalist Katalin Ladik, charting 10 remarkable points in her oeuvre between 1968-1993

Endorsed by the master of sound poetry Henri Chopin, who described hers a “great, magical voice” on the sleeve notes to 1976’s... more
